intro: Dhofaria macleishii, commonly known as the Arabian sandbush, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant has adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface. Dhofaria macleishii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local wildlife. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid environments.
